title: Why was Spirit Visage nerfed exactly?
body:
I honestly just want a reason from Riot for nerfing this item.

Community asked for 25 HP to be added to the Item, thanks for giving us it.

In return we get -5 MR + -100% HP Regeneration. 

So.. We ask for the item to get a small little buff and you nerf it harder then it already was? I want a damn good reason tbh.

(Community even kept saying they wouldn't mind if the price is increased to keep the stats, yet you refused to listen)..

__________________________________________________________

I can't think of any reasoning to nerf it that badly.

Ofc,this ils why i didn't include malph/ammumu etc..in  the  roster  .i put  champions relying on sustain abilities/passives.something giving you a huge amount of health in  a short time

passive sustain is always up, and also double dips off its own increased healing effect.  In combat sustain while situationally higher numbers is, in every case just mentioned overall *significantly* less than they regen from their passive hp regen.

5 hp a second over a thirty minute game is 9,000 healing.  All of those champions will have less healing done than they passively regened.  5% of that healing, then is worth less than 1/20th of the passive regen lost in the longer term for those with high natural health regen.

A level 13 Darius has a base health regen of 4hp/second, his Q can, at max, heal him for 36% of his missing hp.  Let's give him 2k hp, and say he's at 1, and hits three people with his blade.  He'd heal for 719 damage.  the 5% increased healing would account for less than 36 hp, or the equivalent of 100% base hp regen ticking for. . . only 9 seconds.  Oh, and he always gets that regen without regards to hitting anything, or even the presence of enemy champions.  Don't forget, that passive regen *also* occurs during combat.

So, in a best case scenario on the champion with the largest burst healing, the passive hp regen is worth quite a bit more. 

Sure, if he had 4k hp, was at 1, and got three people hit it would take almost 18 seconds of passive regen; but wait, by the time he'd have that much, he's be near level 18, where he gets 5.2 hp/sec so that almost 1440 damage times that 5% increased healing gives only 71 health, which would take just over 13.5 seconds to regen, and does not require the absurd 3,999 missing hp. 

Also, a level 18 heimer gets 8 extra hp a second from 100% increased hp regen, and Gnar gets almost 7 a second.  Some champions with high natural regen get SV too, not just ones who want increased self heals.  Why should they get their item nerfed this way without compensation?

TL;DR in every scenario 100% increased regen is worth more than 5% increased healing unless you get blown up instantly; also 5% increase healing even on a 1440 hp heal, which only Darius and maybe Vlad can even get is less than 75hp and will not be noticeable except over the course of a full game, wherein it is surpassed in every single case by 100% increased base hp regen.

It was a net 0 change really.

Regen is down 40% but effective health is up.

Yes, lowering the magic resist and adding 25 points of hp is actually BETTER than it was.

Actually, if you do the math to compare, there is no point where you will have more effective health after the change, unless you have really low health and really high MR (at 1000 health before purchase, you would also need to have 300 MR for the PBE Spirit Visage to give higher effective health). It's a nerf, any way you look at it.

425+(425x.6)=680
450+(450x.55)=697.5

The actual statistics on the item favor the change in effective.

If you are only looking at the item itself, yes. But, if you look at its real effectiveness on a champion during a game,  the change gives an immediate loss in effective health.

If you were to purchase it at level 1 with 550 health (most tanks have about 550 at level 1) and your base 32 MR, the changes give you 2 less effective health. 

If you have 1000 base health and 39 base MR, the changes give 22.5 less effective health. 

At 2000 base health and 53 MR (standard for level 18), the changes give you 69.25 less effective health.

If you had a number of health items and some extra MR, putting you at 3500 health and 150 MR before purchasing SV, the changes give you 120 less effective health. With that amount of health, you would need over 600 MR before purchasing SV to break even.

In terms of its real power, every change here is a straight up nerf (except for a very small buff to champions with health scalings - like, 2.5 - 5 more shield strength/damage). And, nerfing it may well be justified, but you certainly can't call it a net neutral change.

Lets take a look at a typical build disregarding champion for a second.
{{item:1401}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3193}} 
The effective health of this build is 
2357+(2357x1)=4714 (9428-ish with active)
                                                            2357+(2357x1.25)=5303 (10606-ish with active)

With the changes the effective health is
2382+(2382x1)=4764 (9528-ish)
2382+(2382x1.2)=5240 (10480-ish)

Which is very similar, with a more rounded sum between the two effective healths due to hp rather than resistance, which though we lose 13 points overall for, it makes the build stronger.

For the kicks Imma do the same effective check but as though the items never got changed.

2530+(2530x.9)=4525 (9050-ish)
2530+(2530x1.2)=5566 (11132-ish)

This is 87 points stronger than the new spirit.

ALSO
If you want me to do a different build I can do so, though I believe the results will stay about the same.

1. Label what you are doing. It took about 10 minutes to figure out why you had a random second equation with no explanation as to what anything represents.

2. 13 lower health is statistically weaker. You are going to die more quickly. Not to mention, Spirit Visage is intended to counter magic damage. The impact on effective health against magic damage should be weighted more strongly than the impact on effective health against physical damage. 

3. As your math proves, this is a nerf, even including effective health against physical damage. This is more noticeable the more health you build. Combined with the health regen nerf, it is pretty noticeable.
